prompt_used: You simplify complex texts for non-native English speakers, whose English mastery level is A2. Adapt the text to the needs of the target group. Here is the definition of the A2 level according to CEFR (Common European Framework for Languages): <Can understand sentences and frequently used expressions related to areas of most immediate relevance (e.g. very basic personal and family information, shopping, local geography, employment). Can communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar and routine matters. Can describe in simple terms aspects of his/her background, immediate environment and matters in areas of immediate need.>
original_text: Mice have long been a central part of neuroscience research, providing a flexible model that scientists can control and study to learn more about the intricate inner workings of the brain. Historically, researchers have favored male mice over female mice in experiments, in part due to concern that the hormone cycle in females causes behavioral variation that could throw off results.
simplified_text: Mice are very important in brain research. Scientists use them to learn about how the brain works. In the past, researchers often chose male mice for experiments. They did this because they were worried that female mice, with their hormone changes, might act differently and make the study results less clear.
